title: (x) Vintage Newsreel style fonts - similar to Anzeigen Grotesk {Mike Y}
content:
I am looking for a sans serif font similar to those used in old newsreels.  
Below are some examples of what I’m looking for.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [test\_tube\_front.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015940/http:/typophile.com/files/test_tube_front.jpg) | 45.97 KB |

 [‹ (x) Restaurant & Bar elegant script - Bickham Script {Paul H}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015940/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37328 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Virgula Caralho" contrasty and expressive script - Mommie {Akira} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015940/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37135 "Go to next forum topic")
author: swolfle

comments.content:
I think [Anzeigen Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/anzeigen-grotesk/) would be pretty similar, and probably about the right vintage. You could also fake it with a heavy condensed Helvetica, which is not as old.

- Mike Yanega
